gameRecap.title: Game Recap: Thunder 113, Knicks 112
gameRecap.excerpt: After trading back-and-forth buckets in the final couple minutes, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made a fadeaway from the left corner to take the lead with under two seconds left. Jalen Brunson couldn’t connect on the game-winner and the Thunder defeated the Knicks, 113-112. Jalen Williams (33 points on 14-18 FG, eight assists, four rebounds) and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (19 points, three assists) led the Thunder as Josh Giddey totaled 16 points, 13 rebounds, and 12 assists for his second triple-double of the year. Jalen Brunson led New York with 30 points and seven assists while Miles McBride added 19 points. Oklahoma City moves to 52-22 as the Knicks fall to 44-30. The Thunder take over the top spot in the West with the win.
